intro: Monnina ramosa, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, showy flowers. The plant produces violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Monnina ramosa is adapted to full sun and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy species in xerophytic landscapes.
